vision.notes: Gobies are bony fish and likely possess functional vision. Given their diverse habitats, visual acuity likely varies across species.

mechanoreception.notes: As benthic fish, gobies likely rely on mechanoreception for detecting water movements and prey. Lateral line systems are common in fish.

chemoreception.notes: Fish rely on chemoreception (taste and smell) for food detection and navigation. As bottom-dwellers, gobies likely use this extensively.
